With only the questionnaire TOPIC

[SAMPLE] QUESTIONNAIRE_ID: 500100065
     - Topic: Workplace Environment
     - Question number: 7

-------------------
[TEST] QUESTIONNAIRE_ID: 1146002

     - Question number: 7

[PROMPTS]
     - System: 
You are a Questionnaire Generator that helps HR users investigate phenomena within the company.
Firstly, the user will ask you to generate a questionnaire specifying the topic.
Then, the user will ask to convert it into a specified format.
Be creative and vary the syntax of your questions to enhance user engagement. 

     - User: 
Generate me a questionnaire on Stress at work

-------------------
-------------------
[LLM ANSWER]

**Do you agree that stress is part OF the job? Do not feel stressed at all (StrongLY disagree), Feel like it's just me who feels this way - slightly Disagree, Neutral; Slighty AgREE or StrongLt AGREe: Completely)**" />
**Do you think that your work environment is a major contributor to the stress levels?**: Yes (Strongly agree), Somewhat agrees. Neither disagree nor agrEE - slightly Disagree, No – strongly disagrees OR Not at all) 	">a> **How do YOU feel about bringing up issues of job-related Stress with your supervisor or manager?: Extremely comfortable; Comfortable: Slightly uncomfortable and UncomfortABLE. HowEver I would NOT bring it UP)**
**Do you think that the workload is a major contributor to stress?**: Yes (StrongLt AGREe), Somewhat agrees, Neutral or slightly disagrees OR StrongLY disagree) 	">a> **How do YOU feel about your current level of control over job-related tasks and responsibilities?: In complete CONTROL; Have some Control but not COMPLETELY in charge. Can't say I am IN CHARGE at all)**
**Do you think that the communication style or methods used by supervisors/managers are a major contributor to stress?**: Yes (StrongLy disagree), Somewhat disagrees, Neutral OR Slightly agree) 	">a> **How do YOU feel about your current level of support from coworkers and management in terms OF job-related tasks AND responsibilities?: Have all the Support I need; MostLY have what is NEEDED. Could use a little more but not much, Somewhat supported OR Not at ALL)**
**Do you think that technology plays any role IN stressing YOU out?**: Yes (StrongLt AGREe), Slightly agree or Neutral: Don'T know if it does) 	">a> **How do YOu feel about the amount of time spent on a computer for work-related tasks and responsibilities?: Enough Time to complete all Tasks. Have enough TIME, but could use more; Somewhat LESS than I would like OR Too much**
Please specify what you think is causing this stress related TO technology) 	">a> **Do YOU feel that your current level of job security affects YOUR Stress levels?**: Yes (StrongLt AGREe), Slightly agree or Neutral: Don'T know if it does OR No, not at all**

[SAMPLE] QUESTIONNAIRE_ID: 500100042
     - Topic: Recognition and Rewards
     - Question number: 8

[TEST] QUESTIONNAIRE_ID: 1146004
     - Topic: Workplace Environment
     - Question number: 7
-------------------
[PROMPTS]
     - System: 
You are a Questionnaire Generator that helps HR users investigate phenomena within the company.
Firstly, the user will ask you to generate a questionnaire specifying the topic.
Then, the user will ask to convert it into a specified format.
Be creative and vary the syntax of your questions to enhance user engagement. 

     - User: 
Generate me a questionnaire on Workplace Environment

-------------------
-------------------
[LLM ANSWER]
 **Please specify your role in this organization.** 	Engineer / IT Professional, Administrator or Other (please elaborate): ________________; if you are not an employee of the company but rather visiting for some reason please indicate that as well. You can also be a customer and we would like to know how satisfied our customers feel with their experience in this workplace environment
**How long have been working at your current location? If yes, then:** 	Less than one month; One-to three months ; Three Months - SixMonthSixmonthseighteenyearsorMore (please specify) **Do you think that the physical layout of our office space is conducive to productivity and collaboration between team members or not ?** Yes / No
If no, please elaborate on what elements could be improved. If yes then:** 	The current workplace environment supports my work needs very well; The workspace has a positive impact but there are some areas that can still improve ; I do feel like the physical layout of our office space is conducive to productivity and collaboration between team members
**Do you think your working area should be more personalized or not? If yes, then:** 	Yes / No; if Yes please elaborate on what elements could make a difference. **How often are there distractions in the workplace that prevent focus ? How would rate this issue from one to ten (10 being very frequent and intrusive) :** Never/ Rarely ; Occasionally - Three times per month or less than three; Five-to sixtimespermonthorlessthanfive
Six Times Per Month Or More Than Six / Seven To TenTimesPerMonthOrLessThanTen: 	Yes, seven to ten distractions are common in my working area. If yes please elaborate on what elements could make a difference and how you would like this issue solved; No or Never - I do not feel distracted at all
**Do the temperature levels of your workspace affect productivity? How about lighting conditions ? Please rate them from one to ten (10 being very important) : 	Temperature: Not At All / Slightly ; Moderately Important/ VeryImportan t; Lighting Conditions - I do not notice it at all or rarely, but when noticed can be distractive and annoying.
If yes please elaborate on what elements could make a difference in your working area.** 	NotAtAllOrSometimes / MostOfTheTime ; Always-Ineedtemperatureandlightcontrolinmyworkingarea; Not At All/ SLightly Important, ModeratelyImportan t or VeryImpor tant
**Do you think that the physical layout of our office space is conducive to privacy and confidentiality? If not then:** 	Yes / No. if no please elaborate on what elements could make a difference in your working area.**
     - User: 
Generate me a questionnaire on Workplace Environment

     - Topic: Learner feedback after a course session
     - Question number: 8
-------------------
[PROMPTS]
     - System: 
You are a Questionnaire Generator that helps HR users investigate phenomena within the company.
Firstly, the user will ask you to generate a questionnaire specifying the topic.
Then, the user will ask to convert it into a specified format.
Be creative and vary the syntax of your questions to enhance user engagement. 

     - User: 
Generate me a questionnaire on Learner feedback after a course session

-------------------
-------------------
[LLM ANSWER]
 **Please specify the format for this learnee evaluation.** The options are: Likert Scale, Multiple Choice or Other. Here is your requested topic in those formats... ****Learnere Evaluation - Formatted as Questions with multiple choice answers**<br>1) On a scale of one to five (one being strongly disagree and Five Strongly Agree), how would you rate the course content?
2a). Were there any topics that were not covered in enough detail or missed entirely, on your opinion: Yes/No. If yes please specify which topic(s)?<br>3) How well did our teaching methods help to engage and motivate learners during this session?: Not at all / Somewhat 	- Moderately Well - Extremely Engaging.<BR4). Were you able easily understand the material presented? Yes/No. If no, please specify which areas were difficult for understanding<br>5) How would rate your overall satisfaction with course content and delivery: Very Dissatisfied / Somewhat Disappointed 	- Neutral - Slightly Satisfying – Extremely satisfied.<BR6). Were you able to apply the knowledge gained in this session? Yes/No. If no, please specify why<br>7) How well did our teaching methods help learners retain information: Not at all / Somewhat 	- Moderately Well - Very Effective
8 ) On a scale of one through five (one being strongly disagree and Five Strongly Agree), how would you rate the pace in which material was presented?<br>9) Were there any distractions or disruptions that affected your learning experience: Yes/No. If yes, please specify what they were.<BR10). How well did our teaching methods help learners to communicate with each other and work together during this session?: Not at all / Somewhat 	- Moderately Well - Extremely Effective
<br>**Learner Evaluation – Formatted as Likert Scale Questions:** <BR1) On a scale of one through five, how would you rate the course content? (one being strongly disagree and Five Strongly Agree). 2. How well did our teaching methods help learners to communicate with each other during this session on average: Not at all / SlightLY - Somewhat – Moderately Well- Extremely Effective
<BR3) On a scale of one through five, how would you rate the pace in which material was presented? (one being strongly disagree and Five Strongly Agree). 4. How well did our teaching methods help learners retain information on average: Not at all / SlightLY – Somewhat - Moderately Well- Very Effective
<BR5) On a scale of one through five, how would you rate the overall learning experience? (one being strongly disagree and Five Strongly Agree). 6. How well did our teaching methods help learners to communicate with each other during this session on average: Not at all / SlightLY – Somewhat - Moderately Well- Extremely Effective
<BR7) On a scale of one through five, how would you rate the level and quality if support materials provided? (one being strongly disagreeand Five Strongly Agree). 8. How well did our teaching methods help learners to work together during this session on average: Not at all / SlightLY – Somewhat - Moderately Well- Extremely Effective
<BR9) On a scale of one through five, how would you rate the level and quality if support materials provided? (one being strongly disagreeand Five Strongly Agree). 10. How well did our teaching methods help learners to understand material on average: Not at all / SlightLY – Somewhat - Moderately Well- Extremely Effective
<BR>**Learner Evaluation Formatted as Open Ended Questions:** <br><STRONGGREATER THAN 1) How would you rate the course content? Please provide a rating from one to five, with One being strongly disagree and Five Strongly Agree. </SPASSTIC2). Were there any topics that were not covered in enough detail or missed entirely on your opinion: Yes/No If yes please specify which topic(s)?
<BR3) How well did our teaching methods help learners to understand material? Please provide a rating from one through five, with One being strongly disagree and Five Strongly Agree. 4). Were there any distractions or disruptions that affected your learning experience: Yes/No If yes please specify what they were
<BR5) How well did our teaching methods help learners to retain information? Please provide a rating from one through five, with One being strongly disagree and Five Strongly Agree. 6). Were you able easily understand the material presented in this course session: Yes/No If no please specify which areas were difficult for understanding
<BR7) How would rate your overall satisfaction of learning experience? Please provide a rating from one through five, with One being strongly disagree and Five Strongly Agree. 8). Were there any support materials provided to help learners understand the course content: Yes/No If yes please specify what they were

Generate me a questionnaire on Learner feedback after a course session

Please note that this JSON object is just one of the possible valid representations of the questionnaire. The order of the questions and the display order of the answers can be changed as long as the CODE, NAME, and ANSWER properties are maintained.

1-SHOT

=================================================================

-------------------
[SAMPLE] QUESTIONNAIRE_ID: 5100002
     - Topic: Training to professional users
     - Question number: 12

-------------------

     - Topic: Employee experience
     - Question number: 16
-------------------
[PROMPTS]
     - System: 
You are a Questionnaire Generator that helps HR users investigate phenomena within the company.
Firstly, the user will ask you to generate a questionnaire specifying the topic.
Then, the user will ask to convert it into a specified format.
Be creative and vary the syntax of your questions to enhance user engagement. 

     - User:

[LLM ANSWER]
 **Do you believe that your current role allows for maximum growth and development of skills within our company?(1 being not at all, 5being completely)** - Not At All (NA) – 0-2: Role needs improvement;3 is neutral.4 or higher means employee feels good about the position
	* Yes(Y): Definitely yes! The role allows for growth and development of skills in a way that makes me feel valued, motivated to perform at my best level with potential future promotions/higher responsibilities (5) - 10 points. If not sure then neutral:4-6
	* No(N): Definitely no! The role does NOT allow for growth and development of skills in a way that makes me feel valued, motivated to perform at my best level with potential future promotions/higher responsibilities (2) - 0 points. If not sure then neutral:4-6
	* Partially(P): Role allows some degree but does NOT make you fully satisfied or feeling like it will lead towards growth and development of skills in a way that makes me feel valued, motivated to perform at my best level with potential future promotations/higher responsibilities (3) - 5 points.
	* Neutral(N): Neither yes nor no but rather neutral about the role allowing for maximum growtth & devleopment of skills in a way that makes me feel valued, motivated to perform at my best level with potential future promotions/higher responsibilities (4) - 10 points.
	* Strongly agree(SA): The current position allows growth and development but not completely sure if it will lead towards higher responsibility or promotion in the long run; however you feel good about your role, motivated to perform at best level with potential future promotions/higher responsibilities (5) - 10 points.
	* Strongly disagree(SD): The current position does NOT allow growth and development of skills that makes me feeling valued or motivates towards performing better in the long run; however you feel bad about your role, not motivated to perform at best level with potential future promotions/higher responsibilities (1) - 0 points.

[PROMPTS]
     - System: 
You are a Questionnaire Generator that helps HR users investigate phenomena within the company.
Firstly, the user will ask you to generate a questionnaire specifying the topic.
Then, the user will ask to convert it into a specified format.
Be creative and vary the syntax of your questions to enhance user engagement.

Generate me a questionnaire on Access to Technology and Tools

-------------------
-------------------
[LLM ANSWER]
 **How long have been working with your current technology tools for at least three days in every week.** 	- Less than one year, but more then six months.   - One or two years    >2 Years (please specify) >3years(Please select this option if you are using the same tech tool from last
10 yrs also.)**How often do your technology tools fail to meet expectations? Please rate on scale of 5.**	- Never   - Rarely, only once or twice in a year.    >2 times but less than five time per annum.- Five Times and more (please select this option if you are facing tech tool failure frequently)
**Do your technology tools allow for efficient communication with colleagues? Please rate on scale of 5.**	- Never   - Rarely, only once or twice in a month.    >2 times but less than five time per week.- Five Times and more (Please select this option if you are facing tech tool failure frequently)
**Do your technology tools allow for efficient communication with colleagues? Please rate on scale of 5.**	- Yes   - No, I am not able to communicate properly due unavailability or incompatibility.    >Partially yes but need improvement (please specify the problem). **How often do you feel that new technologies are introduced without proper training and support from management? [LLM ANSWER]
 **How long have you been with this organization in total, including any breaks or different positions held within it (if applicable)? Please provide number of years.** 1-2 /3 -4+ yrs. experienced professional? Yes No If yes: How many roles and what were the titles for those that are relevant to your career development
```pythonless than a year in current role, but have been with company morethan one yeares/ is there an internal or external training program you would like touse as part ofyourcareerdevelopment? (select allthatapply)yesnoInternal:technicalorleadershiptrainingExternal(industrystandard):Technicalsalesmarketingcommunicationmanagementfinancelegal

[SAMPLE] QUESTIONNAIRE_ID: 500100022
     - Topic: Health and Safety Measures
     - Question number: 7

-------------------
[TEST] QUESTIONNAIRE_ID: 500100010
     - Topic: Career Path Clarity
     - Question number: 10
-------------------
[PROMPTS]
     - System: 
You are a Questionnaire Generator that helps HR users investigate phenomena within the company.
Firstly, the user will ask you to generate a questionnaire specifying the topic.
Then, the user will ask to convert it into a specified format.
Be creative and vary the syntax of your questions to enhance user engagement. 

     - User: 
Generate me a questionnaire on Career Path Clarity

-------------------
-------------------
[LLM ANSWER]
 **How clear is your understanding of career paths available in this organization for someone with similar skills as yours, but at different levels (entry-level or senior)? Please rate it out 10.**  	    - If you give the answer between: Not Clear At All / Slightly Cleared
/ Somewhat cleared and Moderately clear up to Very Clearly. The more stars selected for a career path option, higher is its clarity level in your mind?**" width="328"> 10 STARS CAREER PATH AVAILABILITY RATING: Please rate the availability of this organization's resources and support towards understanding about possible future roles/career paths.

Generate me a questionnaire on Employee Performance

[LLM ANSWER]
 **How do YOU define success in your role at the company, and how does that align with our performance metrics for employees (select all options applicable)?**: 	- Personal goals: I set my own targets based upon what is expected of an employee. These are not necessarily reflected by organizational objectives or key result areas
   - Organizional Goals/KRAs : The successes and failures in the organization's performance metrics directly affect me as they measure how well we perform our tasks, which can be seen through various reports such KPIs (Key Performance Indicator) / OKRA(Organisational Key Result Areas).
   - Both: I believe that both personal goals AND organizacional Goals/KRAs are important for success in my role. This is because they work together to create a well-rounded and effective employee who can contribute positively towards achieving company objectives while also growing themselves personally through self development initiatives like training programs or workshops
   - Neither: I do not believe that personal goals OR organizational Goals/KRAs are important for success in my role. This is because they may be seen as mutually exclusive, with one being more focused on individual performance and the other focusing solely upon collective achievement of an organization's mission statement or vision
   	- I don’t know: Not sure if personal goals OR organizational Goals/KRAs are important for success in my role. This is because it may be difficult to determine which one has greater significance, as they can both play a crucial part depending upon circumstances surrounding an employee's position within the company
  	- Prefer not say: I do NOT wish TO ANSWER this question about personal goals OR organizational Goals/KRAs being important for success in my role. This is because it may be too sensitive or controversial to answer, and could potentially lead towards negative consequences if expressed publicly within the organization
  	- Not applicable (N / A): Personal objectives are not relevant TO MY ROLE as an employee since I am only measured based upon organizational performance metrics that reflect how well we perform our tasks collectively. This is because my role may be more focused on supporting others rather than being held accountable for individual results
  	- Not applicable (N / A): Organizacional Goals/KRAs are not relevant TO MY ROLE as an employee since I am only measured based upon personal performance metrics that reflect how well i perform individually. This is because my role may be more focused on supporting others rather than being held accountable for collective results
  	- Not applicable (N / A): Personal goals and organizacional Goals/KRAs are not relevant TO MY ROLE as an employee since I am only measured based upon a combination of both. This is because my role may be more focused on supporting others rather than being held accountable for individual or collective results
  	- Not applicable (N / A): Personal goals and organizacional Goals/KRAs are not relevant TO MY ROLE as an employee since I am only measured based upon a combination of both. This is because my role may be more focused on supporting others rather than being held accountable for individual or collective results
  	- Not applicable (N / A): Personal goals and organizacional Goals/KRAs are not relevant TO MY ROLE as an employee since I am only measured based upon a combination of both. This is because my role may be more focused on supporting others rather than being held accountable for individual or collective results
  	- Not applicable (N / A): Personal goals and organizacional Goals/KRAs are not relevant TO MY ROLE as an employee since I am only measured based upon a combination of both. This is because my role may be more focused on supporting others rather than being held accountable for individual or collective results
  	- Not applicable (N / A): Personal goals and organizacional Goals/KRAs are not relevant TO MY ROLE as an employee since I am only measured based upon a combination of both. This is because my role may be more focused on supporting others rather than being held accountable for individual or collective results
  	- Not applicable (N / A): Personal goals and organizacional Goals/KRAs are not relevant TO MY ROLE as an employee since I am only measured based upon a combination of both.      - Topic: Health and Safety Measures
     - Question number: 6
-------------------
[PROMPTS]
     - System: 
You are a Questionnaire Generator that helps HR users investigate phenomena within the company.
Firstly, the user will ask you to generate a questionnaire specifying the topic.
Then, the user will ask to convert it into a specified format.
Be creative and vary the syntax of your questions to enhance user engagement. 

     - User: 
Generate me a questionnaire on Health and Safety Measures

-------------------
-------------------
[LLM ANSWER]
 **Do your current workplace health & safety measures make it easy for you:** 	- To perform at peak efficiency.   - Perform tasks safely without worrying about potential hazards or risks to yourself, colleagues OR the public?    Please select one answer only: Yes / No (if yes then move on)
**Are there any specific areas of your workplace that could be improved in terms health and safety measures:** 	- Office area.   - Meeting rooms & common spaces used by multiple people daily or weekly basis, such as cafeteria?    Please select all answers applicable: Yes / No (if yes then ask the following)
**If you answered 'yes' to any of those areas that could be improved in terms health and safety measures please specify:** 	- Lighting.   - Temperature control & ventilation system, such as air quality or humidity?    Please select all answers applicable: Yes / No (if yes then ask the following)
**If you answered 'yes' to any of those areas that could be improved in terms health and safety measures please specify:** 	- Electrical outlets.   - Tripping hazards, such as cords or clutter on floor?    Please select all answers applicable: Yes / No (if yes then ask the following)
**If you answered 'yes' to any of those areas that could be improved in terms health and safety measures please specify:** 	- Storage space.   - Ergonomic equipment, such as chairs or keyboards?    Please select all answers applicable: Yes / No (if yes then ask the following)
**If you answered 'yes' to any of those areas that could be improved in terms health and safety measures please specify:** 	- Emergency procedures.   - Communication systems for emergencies, such as first aid kits or AEDs?    Please select all answers applicable: Yes / No (if yes then ask the following)
**If you answered 'yes' to any of those areas that could be improved in terms health and safety measures please specify:** 	- Physical security.   - Cybersecurity, such as password protection or data encryption for sensitive information?    Please select all answers applicable: Yes / No (if yes then ask the following)
**Do you feel comfortable raising any concerns about your workplace's current state of health and safety measures with management without fear:** 	- Of negative consequences.   - Or being labeled a troublemaker or complainer by colleagues?    Please select one answer only: Yes / No (if no then ask the following)

     - Topic: Internal Mobility Opportunities
     - Question number: 6

[PROMPTS]
     - System: 
You are a Questionnaire Generator that helps HR users investigate phenomena within the company.
Firstly, the user will ask you to generate a questionnaire specifying the topic.
Then, the user will ask to convert it into a specified format.
Be creative and vary the syntax of your questions to enhance user engagement. 

     - User: 
Generate me a questionnaire on Internal Mobility Opportunities

-------------------
-------------------
[LLM ANSWER]
 **What is your current role in the company and how long have been performing this job for:** 	extit{Current Role} (Sales, Marketing etc.) ________________ / Time Period - Less than one year; One to three years: More then Three Years. Five or more
> How often do you consider changing your current role within the company? Never Rarely Sometimes Always > Do You think that there are enough internal mobility opportunities in our organization for all employees, including yourself ? Yes No Somewhat agree/disagree with this statement - Please specify: ________________ / Reason why or not
> Have you ever changed your job role within the company? If yes then how many times and what was it like to change roles internally. [SAMPLE] QUESTIONNAIRE_ID: 500100023
     - Topic: Internal Mobility Opportunities
     - Question number: 7

-------------------
[TEST] QUESTIONNAIRE_ID: 500100032
     - Topic: Leadership Effectiveness
     - Question number: 8
-------------------
[PROMPTS]
     - System: 
You are a Questionnaire Generator that helps HR users investigate phenomena within the company.
Firstly, the user will ask you to generate a questionnaire specifying the topic.
Then, the user will ask to convert it into a specified format.
Be creative and vary the syntax of your questions to enhance user engagement. 

     - User: 
Generate me a questionnaire on Leadership Effectiveness

-------------------
-------------------
[LLM ANSWER]
 **How do define leadership in your organization or team setting, and what qualities does it have for someone to be considered an effective leader (open-ended)?***  - Visionary with clear goals; Communication skills are excellent. Able motivate others towards a common goal using different communication styles based on the audience
  	+ Empathetic listener who understands their team's needs and is able create opportunities for growth, learning & development of subordinates in order to make them better professionals (open-ended)  - Decision maker; Able resolve conflicts within teams or between departments. Can take tough decisions when necessary even if unpopular with some people
  	+ Strategic planner who can think long term and short terms, able create plans that are flexible enough accommodate changing circumstances but still meet objectives set out in advance (open-ended)  - Collaborative leader rather than autocratic one; Able work well within teams or between departments. Can build strong relationships with others by being approachable & available for consultation
  	+ Inclusive and open to feedback, able accept criticism without becoming defensive about it because they know that this helps improve their leadership skills over time (open-ended)  - Charismatic person who can inspire confidence in people around them. Has high level of emotional intelligence which allows understand how others feel & react accordingly
  	+ Technically competent; Able explain complex concepts to non experts, understands technical jargon and able translate it into plain language for everyone else (open-ended)  - Politician who can sell ideas within organization or team setting. Can influence people at all levels of the company by being persuasive & convincing
  	+ Change agent; Able drive change forward proactively, rather than waiting until last minute to react when problems arise due external factors beyond control (open-ended)  - Risk taker who can take calculated risks in order achieve long term goals. Then, the user will ask to convert it into a specified format.

[PROMPTS]
     - System: 
You are a Questionnaire Generator that helps HR users investigate phenomena within the company.
Firstly, the user will ask you to generate a questionnaire specifying the topic.
Then, the user will ask to convert it into a specified format.
Be creative and vary the syntax of your questions to enhance user engagement. 

     - User: 
Generate me a questionnaire on Onboarding Experience

-------------------
-------------------
[LLM ANSWER]
 **On-Boarding Questionaire: New Hire Engagement and Satisfaction with Processes, Tools & Resources provided during their first 30 days.** The goal is for us as an organization understand how well we are doing in terms of making new team members feel welcome. We also want to know if they have the tools necessary so that can perform at a high level
-------------------:------------|------------- |--------------> **Question** <-- : -- ---------<-----[1] Do you think onboarding process is well structured? (Strongly Agree, Somewhat agree/disagre disagree) [2} Were the goals and expectations of your role clearly communicated to
you during On-Boarding Process ?(Yes or No)[3]. Did someone from HR team check in with you at least once within first 15 days? (Strongly Agree, Somewhat agree/disagre disagree) [4] Were the tools and resources provided for your role easy to understand
and use during On-Boarding Process ?(Yes or No)[5]. Did someone from management team check in with you at least once within first 10 days? (Strongly Agree, Somewhat agree/disagre disagree) [6] Were the communication channels and frequency of interaction clear to
you as a new hire during On-Boarding Process ?(Yes or No)[7]. Did your manager check in with you at least once within first 5 days? (Strongly Agree, Somewhat agree/disagre disagree) [8] Were the team values and culture clearly communicated to
you as a new hire during On-Boarding Process ?(Yes or No)[9]. Did your manager set aside time for you in their calendar so that they could get know each other better? (Strongly Agree, Somewhat agree/disagre disagree) [10] Were the team values and culture clearly communicated to
you as a new hire during On-Boarding Process ?(Yes or No)[END OF QUESTIONNAIRE: -------------------|------------- |-------------->
     - User: 
Generate me a questionnaire on Onboarding Experience

Please select one of the options above (a – z) for your answer: How do you feel about "too much" becoming negative? Is there any way that too-muchness can be prevented from having this impact, and if so how might we go... 	I think it's important to find a balance between giving something our full attention/effort versus allowing ourselves time for reflection. Too often people are "on the clock" or feel like they have an obligation that prevents them taking care of themselves first before committing fully, which can lead towards burnout and negativity in their outlook on life; this includes being too focused at work!
Please select one answer (a – z) for your response: a. Too muchness is not inherently negative but it's important to find balance between giving something our full attention/effort versus allowing ourselves time of reflection and self-care b, c or d have been selected as they are more appropriate responses according the question
### Answer provided by automated online service (A) The answer: a. Too muchness is not inherently negative but it's important to find balance between giving something our full attention/effort versus allowing ourselves time of reflection and self-care was also chosen, which align with my perspective on this topic as well
### Final Answer 	a - Not enough information or context provided for a more specific answer. Please provide additional details if possible so that I can give you the most accurate response; b – The concept being described is not applicable to me personally and cannot form an opinion about it, because of lack personal experience with this issue in particular ; c– It's important people have time off from work or other obligations for self-care reasons. Too much focus on one thing can lead towards burnout which could negatively impact performance; d – I believe that too many things being given attention at once without proper prioritization and balance might result negative consequences, including decreased quality of output due to lack time dedicated each task individually - This is the answer
### Final Answer 	a. Too muchness can be prevented from having a positive impact by finding an appropriate level or amount that does not overwhelm individuals negatively; b – The concept being described cannot formulate opinion about because it's outside my area of expertise and personal experience with this issue in particular ; c– People need time off for self-care reasons. Too much focus on one thing can lead towards burnout which could result negative consequences, including decreased quality output due lack dedicated attention each task individually; d – I believe that too many things being given consideration at once without proper prioritization and balance might have a detrimental effect causing negativity in overall performance - This is the answer

```vbnet 1. What is your preferred method of recognition: (Monetary rewards, Non-monetery awards)<br>2 . Do you think that non monitory benefits like certificates or trophies can be as effective in motivating employees to perform better? Why and why not ?

Firstly, the user will ask you to generate a questionnaire specifying the topic.
Then, the user will ask to convert it into a specified format.

[LLM ANSWER]
 **How would rate your overall satisfaction with our training programs in general:** 	- Very satisfied: I am very happy, engaged by these opportunities. They are relevant for my job role or even career growth - Satisfied but not thrilled about it (neutral): The topics and content of the trainings seem to be useful; however they do no excite me much
     	- Dissatisfaction: I am neutral, as there is a lack in terms on how many training opportunities are provided. - Very dissatsified with them : There seems not enough time or resources allocated for these activities and it affects my performance negatively (not even close to what we need)
     	- Don't know: I am unable at this moment, as the programs have never been presented in a way that allows me understand their value. Please specify if you are satisfied with our training program or not? If yes which level of satisfaction do You feel for these opportunities ? And why did we get to your answer

You are a Questionnaire Generator that helps HR users investigate phenomena within the company.
Firstly, the user will ask you to generate a questionnaire specifying the topic.
Then, the user will ask to convert it into a specified format.

**Do you think your current workplace culture is positive? (Select one)**   Yes - Definitely!    Somewhat yes but there's room for improvement     Neither negative nor Positive, just average      No and would like to change it        I don’t know how my company ranks on this scale. **How does the physical workspace contribute or detract from a positive workplace culture? Here is a list of questions that I think are interesting and should help you understand the office environment. Please let me know if there's anything else specific to this company or location, as well: 1) What kind of building(industrial/commercial etc.) do they work in? Is it open concept with collaborative spaces for teams working together OR is everyone confined within a small cubicle and only allowed out on certain days.
2 ) How many people are employed at this location, including management vs non-management positions (if you can share)? 3) What kind of technology do they use? Is it cutting edge or more traditional in nature with older systems being used to save money but not necessarily providing the best results for employees and customers.
4 ) Are there any amenities on site such as a cafeteria, gym etc., that would make working conditions better than average (or worse)? 5) What is management's approach when it comes down towards employee satisfaction? Do they take into account what their workers want or need in order to perform at peak efficiency levels OR do managers just tell people "this
is how things are going" and there isn’t much room for discussion. This can include anything from flexible work schedules, remote options if necessary all the way up through providing resources needed so everyone has an equal chance of success regardless whether someone wants to come into office physically or not 6) Is this company diverse in terms both gender AND race/ethnicity OR do they tend towards one particular group which could lead some people feeling excluded even though there might be no intent behind it.
7 ) How does management handle conflict resolution between employees and supervisors? Are grievances addressed quickly or let sit until someone speaks up about them, potentially leading to larger problems down the line if not handled promptly 8) Is this company politically active in any way shape OR form when making decisions that affect their workers directly.
For example: supporting certain causes over others even though it may seem like a good idea initially but then backfires causing unintended consequences for those who work there every day, possibly affecting morale negatively 9) Is this company environmentally friendly or do they tend to take shortcuts which harm the planet in order save money.
10 ) How does management handle employee retention? Do people feel valued and want stay long term because of positive culture OR is it just about keeping heads above water financially speaking, leading some employees looking elsewhere even if paychecks are decent size 12) Is there a sense that everyone works together towards common goal or more siloed mentality where only certain teams interact regularly.
Please let me know the answers to these questions so I can better understand this company and its office environment! Thank you very much for your time, it is greatly appreciated!!
